page.title: 05TRANSPORT FORRES WEST
page.content: The main road running through Forres is the "A96". Running west it leads to Nairn and Inverness. The High Street running through Forres gets very busy during the summer season. Soon there will be a by-pass built around Forres. This will allow big lorries and heavy traffic to pass through with-out conjesting the high street. Other forms of transport in the West of Forres are the Bus Station and the Railway Station. The Bus Station runs regular services to and from Elgin. They run free services to Fine Fare. This is to help the old and the unemployed, because they haven't enough money for the bus fare. They also run regular services for school children who have no transport. The Railway Station runs trains to different towns and cities.
